intro: Rostellularia procumbens var. riukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a herbaceous perennial with prostrate growth habit, characterized by slender stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Gesneriaceae family.
